Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • Parser

  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulate access to the input code. Read an assembly language command, parse it, and provide convenient access to the commandâ€™s components (fields and symbols). In addition, remove all white space and comments.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Parser(java.lang.String file)
      Open the input file/stream and prepare to parse it

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void advance()
      Read the next command from the input and makes it the current command.
      type commandType()
      Returns the type of the current command: A_COMMAND for @Xxx where Xxx is either a symbol or a decimal number C_COMMAND for dest=comp;jump L_COMMAND (actually, pseudo-command) for (Xxx) where Xxx is a symbol.
      java.lang.String comp()
      Return the computation mnemonic of the current command.
      java.lang.String dest()
      Returns the destination mnemonic of the current command.
      boolean endOfFile()
      Whether the file has no more commands
      java.lang.String jump()
      Return the jump mnemonic of the current command.
      java.lang.String symbol()
      Return the symbol or decimal Xxx of the current command @Xxx or (Xxx).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Parser

        public Parser(java.lang.String file)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Open the input file/stream and prepare to parse it
        Parameters:
        file - Path of the file to parse
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error encountered in attempting to read file

    • Method Detail

      • advance

        public void advance()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Read the next command from the input and makes it the current command. If no next command exists, set the current command to null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error accessing the file

      • commandType

        public type commandType()
        Returns the type of the current command:
        • A_COMMAND for @Xxx where Xxx is either a symbol or a decimal number
        • C_COMMAND for dest=comp;jump
        • L_COMMAND (actually, pseudo-command) for (Xxx) where Xxx is a symbol.
        Returns:
        The command type

      • symbol

        public java.lang.String symbol()
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Return the symbol or decimal Xxx of the current command @Xxx or (Xxx). Should be called only when the commond is a valid A command or L command.
        Returns:
        The symbol portion
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The command is not a valid A or C command

      • comp

        public java.lang.String comp()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Return the computation mnemonic of the current command. Should be called only when the command is a valid C command.
        Returns:
        The computation mnemonic
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - the command is not a valid C command

      • dest

        public java.lang.String dest()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns the destination mnemonic of the current command. Should be called only when the command is a valid C command.
        Returns:
        The destination mnemonic
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The command is not a valid C command

      • jump

        public java.lang.String jump()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Return the jump mnemonic of the current command. Should be called only when the command is a valid C command.
        Returns:
        The jump mnemonic
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The command is not a valid C command

      • endOfFile

        public boolean endOfFile()
        Whether the file has no more commands
        Returns:
        true if no commands remain and vice-versa
